paragraphs.text: Let me give you some background on the short-lived friendship between Material Design and I: It all started in the FABulous Summer of 2014, I was about to enter the 6th grade and my passion in graphic design kick-started. There to help me learn about it, was Google — who just unveiled their brand new design language, which within the next few months was going to become so overused that you could rename it to any song played on a pop-music radio station. Better yet was the fact that my father and I had just created our startup, which I was the designer for (By the way, you should totally check out the company). Of course, since I was beginning, I used dribbble to guide me through the many upcoming trends of design, including the embarrassing throwback to long-shadows 😷, and one of the up and coming trends was Material Design. I was intrigued; as far as I was concerned, Material Design was the easiest way to design interfaces. I mean everything was figured out for you; the color palettes were from a selection of colors, the interface-structures were given, the components all have instruction, they even tell you what the shadows should look like. It was like one of those fill in the blank stories, where you replace certain blank spaces with words — but in this case, you’re replacing given fields with ones pertaining to your application. Of course, being a sixth grader I couldn’t resist filling all those blanks, and with that, I was hooked.

Of course, being a sixth grader I couldn’t resist filling all those blanks, and with that, I was hooked.

cf6a2089f736.title: I think you misunderstand the purpose of native design standards.

paragraphs.text: I think you misunderstand the purpose of native design standards. The intent is to create familiar experiences that are easy to use. The purpose is not to be a creative buzz-kill, but to help your grandma order a pizza, or your younger brother play an education game. Using a familiar look and feel lowers the learning curve. Users will expect things…
paragraphs.name: ccb4

paragraphs.text: Hello Nikhil! Your text made me think about how many aesthetics I have used blindly without interpreting them and adapting them to create a product that has its own character. This goes against other text I read last week about the dribblization of design. We have to use our thinking heads more than anything to develop real solutions and not just follow aesthetic currents or patterns. Thank you!
paragraphs.name: 1cbf

paragraphs.text: Great article! Im sure you can understand my shock when I read that you were in the sixth grade a few years ago, lol. I agree with your thoughts on Material Design. I’ve followed its specs to a T on some projects but like you said, throw in your own personality and thats where great apps will stand out. You’re doing a great job at asking questions…

Thank you so much!

e5e77b5c0d9f.title: Nikhil it is great to meet such an opinionated young designer!

paragraphs.text: Nikhil it is great to meet such an opinionated young designer! You brought up some interesting points, but remember, design is an ongoing and ever evolving conversation between people and products, and in software nothing is really set in stone.
Material design is a living framework that can be interpreted and pulled in many…

e26db912193b.title: The core philosophy of material design is to treat interface as a physical artefact, like pieces of…

paragraphs.text: The core philosophy of material design is to treat interface as a physical artefact, like pieces of paper overlaying each other for example. Everything from visual treatments to animations is derived from this singular philosophy.
paragraphs.name: 042f

Btw you were highlighted great MD feat. branded UI examples: usually these companies do this…

2a7dcbaedd21.title: You will NEVER, EVER convince an engineer that hiring a designer is better than empowering…

paragraphs.text: You will NEVER, EVER convince an engineer that hiring a designer is better than empowering themselves by using Material Design.
paragraphs.name: c4b6

paragraphs.text: I have been told multiple times since MD’s availability that certain scale projects are simply not worth the cost of an actual designer over an already finished template.

57ed646d1a89.title: I think this was an excellent job, Nikhil.

paragraphs.text: I think this was an excellent job, Nikhil. A thirst for knowledge and understanding of your environment will make you a great designer. Question ‘why’ ALL the time and you will hone your skills to be independent of any design pattern.
